intro: Psychotria cochabambana, commonly known as the Cochabamba Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as cloud forests. Psychotria cochabambana is also notable for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though research on its properties remains limited.
